summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York City. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, including the prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, the failure to assign him a cellmate after his cellmate was transferred, the malfunctioning camera system, and various procedural failures by MCC staff.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose in his cell. The SIS investigation was inconclusive. He was placed on suicide watch and then psychological observation.

events.title: Cameras Found Not Working
events.description: The SIS lieutenant discovered the MCC's camera system was not recording. She notified the captain and associate warden and wrote a memo.

events.title: Reyes Transferred, Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of the MCC. Staff failed to assign a new cellmate to Jeffrey Epstein, leaving him alone in his cell contrary to psychology requirements.

events.title: Unauthorized Phone Call to Epstein
events.description: Unit manager Nathaniel provided Epstein with an unmonitored phone call on an unsecured line. Epstein claimed to be calling his mother, but a male answered the number.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC. He was found with a noose. The incident was investigated as a suicide.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City
keyFacts: The lieutenant's investigation into Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt was inconclusive, with Epstein denying self-harm and denying his cellmate harmed him.
Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was transferred out on August 9, 2019. Multiple staff failures led to Epstein not being assigned a new cellmate, contrary to psychology requirements.
The MCC's camera system stopped recording on July 29, 2019, and was not fixed prior to Epstein's death, despite the SIS lieutenant notifying the captain and associate warden on August 8.
Epstein was given an unauthorized, unmonitored phone call on an unsecured line by his unit manager the night before his death, a significant security violation.
The lieutenant attributes Epstein's ability to take his own life to systematic failures, including the lack of a cellmate and failures in conducting counts and rounds.
